alert.note: Alert for Clayton; Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:16PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at Woolsey Road near Woolsey affecting Spalding, Clayton and Fayette Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Americus, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Flint River at Woolsey Road near Woolsey. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins of the natural flood plain upstream and downstream from the gage on Hampton Woolsey Road. This will primarily affect woodlands...agricultural fields and pastures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 48.3 feet and steady. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Wednesday was 48.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 48.1 feet on 01/14/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1230 AM EST.
